article.headline: Oral Roberts 75, Valparaiso 60
article.story: TULSA, Okla. (AP) -- Adam Liberty scored 16 points and sparked a second-half run that carried Oral Roberts past Valparaiso 75-60 on Saturday. Liberty, a 6-foot-2 junior guard who was averaging 6.3 points per game, was 6-of-11 from the field, including 4-of-8 3-pointers. He had 11 points in the second half. Caleb Green added 14 points and 12 rebounds for the Golden Eagles (9-7, 2-0 Mid-Continent Conference), who have won three in a row and snapped the Crusaders' three-game winning streak. Green had the 54th double-double of his career, tying the ORU record set by Mark Acres from 1981-85. Calum MacLeod came off the bench to lead the Crusaders (6-9, 1-1) with 17 points and four rebounds. MacLeod was 6-of-7 from the field and 4-of-5 on free throws. MacLeod entered the game averaging 3.8 points. ORU scored the first 10 points of the second half, including five by Liberty, to open a 46-31 lead. Shawn King contributed 13 points and six rebounds for the Golden Eagles, who committed a season-low six turnovers compared to 15 for the Crusaders. ORU outrebounded Valparaiso 32-29. The Golden Eagles made 8-of-20 treys while the Crusaders were 2-of-14. The lead seesawed through the first five minutes before Ken Tutt sank a 3-pointer that ignited an 18-6 run to give ORU a 26-15 advantage. Valparaiso cut its deficit to 33-27 before a 3-point play by ORU's Marchello Vealy. The Crusaders countered with Samuel Haanpaa's two free throws and a Jarryd Loyd basket in the final 50 seconds of the first half to move within 36-31 at intermission.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
